page.title: 13Education
page.content: The youngest children spend some of the afternoon in the wooden Wendy House playing keeping house, with various toys and games, and in sand and water play. They have regular P.E. in the hall which is equipped with large climbing apparatus.Some mothers come into school to help in the library, and help the infants with their cooking of gingerbread men, tarts and biscuits. Parents also hear children read and help to make costumes and props for the Christmas concerts. There are three lower junior teachers with three classes of about 25 children.There is a team leader and the day is operated along team lines.
